page.title: 01MONIFIETH AND AROUND
page.content: { Monifieth}is on the north bank of the River Tay to the east of Dundee and Broughty Ferry.North and West lie farm lands,the sandy golf links and vast acres of Barry Buddon Camp.From Dundee the Dighty Water flows down to the Tay on the east side while on the westside of the town Buddon Burn runs through fields,links and firing ranges into the Tay Firth.Belts of deciduous trees pine and spruce break up the landsape { Monifieth}held burgh status from 1895 until 1975 when regional adjustments brought it into the City of Dundee.The village as it is locally known is now a fashionable dormitory suburb of the City. Population figures have grown_400 in 1841 to 8000 in 1985.From 1961-1971 it grew fast_3474 to 6338,figure in 1977 was 7430.Increases in population led to building developments.
